column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have been taking this drug for about 8 months. I began taking it in the morning but by noon I got tired and had to take a nap. My Dr. perscribed citilopram to take in the am and instructed me to take the bupropoin at dinner. It helps me calm down from the citilopram and lets my mind relax and be able to sleep at night. It has helped my depression greatly.
I don't know which medication did it but it helped me quit smoking. I have smoked for 11 years
column3: heavy! but now im a non smoker. "

35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $1$1$4$I was perscribed Wellbutrin and originally was given the generic form (ck spelling) Bupropion ER 150 MG and it seemed to work great I had NO desire to smoke started to lose weight and felt great then the pharmacy prescribed  Budeprion SR 150 MG and after a week i felt worse but the pharmacy stated it was the  same stuff  but I have both bottles and they are both different spellings and they MOST DEFINATELY work differently!!  I kept taking now for 2 months and put back on the weight I lost started to smoke again and feel so depressed I can;t stand it.  I will talk to my DR tomorrow!!  I am so mad!!
